title: Trying to identify wierd sans serif font
content:
Hi guys,  
More than 15 years ago, I was fiddling around with a logotype for my cousin's company. I want to do some edits to the logo, but I can't seem to be able to ID the font and I have no further info on where to find it.  
In spite of my recommendation, my cousin used the font at some point in time, to product body text in a brochure. It looks awful, but it might just be my life line, since I can provide you with sample text to cover almost the entire alphabet .  
I am attaching it hereby, with thanks in advance for helping me out.

Best regards,  
Victor

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [alp font CAPITALS.JPG](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015221944/http:/typophile.com/files/alp%20font%20CAPITALS.JPG) | 204 KB |
| [alp font.JPG](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015221944/http:/typophile.com/files/alp%20font.JPG) | 237.92 KB |
author: vasinvictor

comments.content:
I don't know if you need this as well, but [The ALP RAIL Logotype](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015221944/http:/www.alprail.com/images/SIGN_1.GIF) uses [Revue](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015221944/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/adobe/revue/bold/glyphs.html) by Adobe, Linotype, and others.  
- Herb
